Home → Events and activities → Bookfest → An evening of poetry and music with Liz Lochhead and band

An evening of poetry and music with Liz Lochhead and band

  • Woodbridge Library

  • Wed 26 Oct, 2016
  • 1930 – 2100
  • Doors open 1900

  • Tickets: £8
  • Buy a ticket

We’ll be transforming Woodbridge Library into a Poetry Cafe for this very special evening with the remarkable poet Liz Lochhead.

Join us any time from 7pm. Buy a drink, find a table and listen to Celtic folk fusion band, Aartwork, before we are treated to a reading from Liz at 7.30pm

Liz was Scots Makar – the Scottish equivalent of Poet Laureate – from 2011-2016, and Poet Laureate for Glasgow before that. She won the Queen’s Gold Medal for Poetry in 2015. A true poet of the people, her work is popular, warm and witty but also challenging and fierce. She has published 18 books, from 1972’s Memo For Spring to a book of plays in 2012. Later collections, often written in Scots and Glasgow dialect, include True Confessions and New Clichés (1985), Bagpipe Muzak (1991), The Colour of Black and White (2003) and A Choosing (2011).

In this fun and moving, stimulating and inspiring evening, Liz will be reading a selection of her poems. There will be music from Aartwork at the beginning and conclusion of the evening, and during a 20 minute interval. Drinks and books will be available for sale in what promises to be a night to remember. Don’t miss it!
